alert.note: Alert for Kankakee (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 21 at 7:54PM CST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity for the following rivers in Illinois... Kankakee River at Momence affecting Kankakee County. For the Kankakee River...including Momence...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Kankakee River from IL/IN state line downstream to confluence with Iroquois River at Aroma Park, including the Momence gauge. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Low-lying wetlands, forest land, park land and agricultural land along the river may flood. Roadways along the river may flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CST Sunday satellite imagery and river gauge observations indicated an ice jam from near Kankakee to near Sun River Terrace. This ice appears to be expanding upstream toward Momence. The stage on the Momence gauge was 3.9 feet. - Forecast...The river may exceed flood stage near Sun River Terrace and Momence over the next several days if the ice jam continues to worsen. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means water levels above flood stage are possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Persons along rivers and streams in the watch area should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday afternoon at 200 PM CST.
